other_tests.findings: Detected alpha streptococcus (gram-positive cocci) and neisseria (gram-negative cocci). A gram-stained specimen showed three types of microbes: gram-positive cocci, gram-negative cocci, and gram-negative rod.

Showed exacerbation of lung suppuration with parapneumonic effusion and increased gas formation, revealing a round mass in the consolidated right middle lobe that enhanced equally to the pulmonary vessel.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Showed increased findings compared to a previous plain chest CT.

other_tests.findings: Confirmed the cavitary lesion was mainly composed of granulation tissue and not covered with endothelium; showed gram-positive cocci in the cavity and cavitary wall.
